alert.note: Alert for King; Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 02 at 11:53PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: .Heavy rain at times tonight into early Monday morning. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Washington, including the following counties, King and Snohomish. * WHEN...Until 545 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1149 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This could cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rain amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. Combined with melting snow or slush from recent snowfall this additional rain could result in minor flooding and ponding on roadways. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
